```{r setup, include=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(knitr)

knit_hooks$set(plot=function(x, options) {
  sprintf("<img src='../%s%s-%d.%s'/ title='%s'/>", 
          options$fig.path, options$label, options$fig.cur, options$fig.ext, options$fig.cap)

})

opts_chunk$set(
  echo=TRUE,
  fig.path="static/geoknife-data/",
  fig.width = 6,
  fig.height = 6,
  fig.cap = "TODO"
)

set.seed(1)
```

## What is a geojob?

A `geojob` is the object that contains all of the necessary processing information to execute a data request to GDP. The `geojob` is made up of the `stencil`, `fabric`, and `knife` (if you need to learn what these components are, please visit [the previous lesson](/usgs-packages/geoknife_Discovery)).

looking at this for reference: http://usgs-r.github.io/geoknife/#geojob-details
